qas.question: When did Britain withdraw from Aden?
When did Britain withdraw from Bahrain?
When did Britain withdraw from the Maldives?
Who was Harold Wilson's Defense Secretary?
Where did Britain's army attack in 1961?

context: While the Suez Crisis caused British power in the Middle East to weaken, it did not collapse. Britain again deployed its armed forces to the region, intervening in Oman (1957), Jordan (1958) and <a4_0>Kuwait<a4_0/> (1961), though on these occasions with American approval, as the new Prime Minister Harold Macmillan's foreign policy was to remain firmly aligned with the United States. Britain maintained a military presence in the Middle East for another decade. In January 1968, a few weeks after the devaluation of the pound, Prime Minister Harold Wilson and his Defence Secretary <a3_0>Denis Healey<a3_0/> announced that British troops would be withdrawn from major military bases East of Suez, which included the ones in the Middle East, and primarily from Malaysia and Singapore. The British withdrew from Aden in <a0_0>1967<a0_0/>, Bahrain in <a1_0>1971<a1_0/>, and Maldives in <a2_0>1976<a2_0/>.
